item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, December 8, 2024 at 7:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Mise: Dev tools, env vars, task runner (57 points | 12 comments)

3. Researchers Use AI to Turn Sound Recordings into Accurate Street Images (77 points | 30 comments)
4. Tokyo University Used "Tiananmen Square" Keyword to Block Chinese Admissions (65 points | 45 comments)
5. SQLite changed temp file prefix after McAfee users called devs to complain (65 points | 15 comments)
6. Qutebrowser: A keyboard-driven, Vim-like browser (59 points | 26 comments)
7. My Biggest Project So Far (6 points | discuss)
8. Nyxt: The Hacker's Browser (384 points | 190 comments)
9. The Need to Grind Concrete Examples Before Jumping Up a Level of Abstraction (85 points | 23 comments)
10. Mend it Mark gets suspect copyright strike for £25k audio amp repair (138 points | 49 comments)
11. Reverse engineering the Sega Channel game image file format (204 points | 36 comments)
12. Zizmor would have caught the Ultralytics workflow vulnerability (36 points | 9 comments)
13. China Completes Green Belt Around Taklamakan Desert (108 points | 66 comments)
14. Ask HN: Is NPM Having an Outage? (21 points | 18 comments)
15. Ask HN: Does retro computing make you feel younger or older? (33 points | 25 comments)
16. Just: Just a Command Runner (558 points | 306 comments)
17. Small AI Chip Maker Marvell Now More Valuable Than Intel (14 points | 8 comments)
18. Unless my phone can be a PC, I don't want to keep paying for extra performance (66 points | 72 comments)
19. Show HN: Cut the crap – remove the AI bullshit from websites (132 points | 85 comments)
20. Arthur Cravan: The Disappearing Dadaist (18 points | discuss)
21. Scratch and Sniff Stickers and the Gas Panic of '87 (25 points | discuss)
22. UnitedHealth's Effort to Deny Coverage for a Patient's Care (178 points | 136 comments)
23. Whose Weil? Simone, Patron Saint of Everyone (42 points | 17 comments)
24. Flappy Bird in 1000 lines of C (98 points | 39 comments)
25. Show HN: SQL Simulator – Create Subsetted Databases in Docker or K8s (27 points | 3 comments)
26. "BGP at home": getting a DIA circuit installed at home (177 points | 38 comments)
27. The largest open-source dataset of car designs, including their aerodynamics (289 points | 100 comments)
28. Ask HN: What are the best programmable holiday lights? (91 points | 42 comments)
29. SP1: A performant, 100% open-source, contributor-friendly zkVM (42 points | 14 comments)
30. How Much Do I Need to Change My Face to Avoid Facial Recognition? (40 points | 35 comments)
